data.improvements#Improvements:
TACT-87: Support right-click, and Control with left-click (#455, #550, #556, #563)
TACT-50: Select tasks by cursor (#510)
TACT-294: Tags window doesn't close when ESC is pressed (#533)
TACT-137: Rework arrow experience (#495)
TACT-138: Highlight actual context (#495)
TACT-40: Make editor context consistent (#459)
TACT-105: Improve experience while tag editing (#456)
TACT-216: It isn't possible to remove one or more tags from the editor's list (#461)
TACT-223: No scrolling option when creating more than 14 spaces (#460)
data.fixes#Fixes:
TACT-137 fixes (#549)
TACT-105 fixes (#555, #564)
TACT-138 fixes (#555, #564, #567)
TACT-245: Task with an empty name jumps in edit mode (#477)
TACT-247: The presence of sorting in the context of the inbox tab (#457)

data.improvements-2#Improvements:
TACT-92: Simplify the logic of the editor while task switching (#423)
TACT-93: Activate editing mode by clicking on wide area (#360)
TACT-99: Support d'n'd on random place of a task, change cursor to pointer for task list (#384)
TACT-100: Rework touch and click experience (#384)
TACT-104: Bad experience with Esc and task editing (#450)
TACT-170: Add crosses to tags (#369, #401)
TACT-203: Bad editor unfocusing experience (#360)
TACT-210: Implement new space and origin creation on client side (#402, #464)
TACT-241: Strange appearance of the target binding window (#466)
TACT-255: Fix dependency tree (#409)
data.fixes-1#Fixes:
TACT-118: Exclude All spaces from the suggestion (#449, #463)
TACT-212: Drop menu hides behind task list (#369)
TACT-233: When scaling the window, the page collapses completely (#379, #383)
TACT-242: Floating tag and focus on hidden delete button (#447)
TACT-257: Window Overlay in Today Tab (#454, #465)

data.quick-start#Quick Start:
Requirements:
Docker Desktop.
Access tokens for
Font Awesome
Graphite (optional)
Sentry (optional)
Vercel (optional)




$ alias run='./Taskfile'
$ alias activate='source bin/activate'
$ activate && run setup

$ $(sleep 3; open http://localhost:3000) &; run start
data.manage-secrets#Manage secrets:
You can update tokens by the following commands
$ run set_fontawesome_token
$ run set_graphite_token
$ run set_sentry_token
$ run set_vercel_token
data.local-development#Local development:
You could use a local environment, but it's not deterministic
$ npm ci --ignore-scripts --include=dev
$ npm run dev
$ npm run build
$ npm run start

$ $(sleep 3; open http://localhost:3000) &; npm run start
data.local-development-with-the-docker#Local:
You could use Docker CLI to build a deterministic environment
$ run install [--from-scratch]
$ run dev
$ run build [--from-scratch]
$ run start [--from-scratch]

$ $(sleep 5; open http://localhost:3000) &; run start

$ run npm ci --ignore-scripts --include=dev
$ run npm ...
data.local-development-inside-the-docker#Loca:
You could use Docker CLI to build an isolated environment
$ run build docker [--from-scratch]
$ run start docker [--from-scratch]

$ $(sleep 3; open http://localhost:3000) &; run start docker

$ run isolated
data.installation#Installation:
$ run tools npm ci
$ run whoami
data.graphite-cli#Graphite CLI:
Useful: docs, src
$ activate

$ run gt --help
data.sentry-cli#Sentry CLI:
Useful: docs, src
$ activate

$ run sentry --help
data.vercel-cli#Vercel CLI:
Useful: docs, src
$ activate
$ run vercel link
$ run vercel deploy

$ run vercel help
You can avoid using the token parameter when working with these commands,
it's substituted automatically under the hood.
data.vercel-shows-inconsistent-state-of-depen:
You can drop Vercel's cache by running:
$ run vercel --force
data.font-awesome-has-failed-builds-after-ver:
Check fontawesome-common-types, it must be exactly one.
$ npm list | grep fortawesome
# if not, do the following
$ npm update
See, the issue.
